ygData.msgSnippet: Dear Harry, I m writing because I have some question concerning the memory leak issue that was discussed in this forum a few days ago. First let me describe

Dear Harry,
I'm writing because I have some question concerning the memory leak 
issue that was discussed in this forum a few days ago. 
First let me describe what I use Cantera for. I do some transient 
reactor network simulation in Matlab. During the simulations I need 
to change the configuration of the reactor network several times. 
Therefore I delete the network object from the Matlab workspace and 
than I recreate the modified one. But after a while I run out of 
memory. The commands cleanup, clear and so don't affect anything. 
Only finishing the entire Matlab helps. 
So far I couldn't localize the reason for this, is it Matlab or is it 
something in the Cantera library. (By the way I download the cantera 
binary and I'm not so familiar in debugging). 
But recently I read this email of Martin Olausson and your answer 
with recommendation to use the program appdelete() in misc.cpp. Can 
you tell me how I have to use it through the matlab interface. Which 
steps are there required?
Thank you very much.
  Regards
     Albrecht
